label: 琵琶
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 56th  . Nara National Museum . 2004
説明文: A short-necked Japanese lute related to the Chinese pipa, the biwa has a pear-shaped body with a shallow, rounded back and either four or five silk strings attached to slender lateral tuning pegs. It is played by plucking the strings with a large, flared plectrum.
